node.title: China Warns U.S., Allies Will 'Pay a Price' for Diplomatic Boycott of Winter Olympics 2022
node.alt: China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin speaks at a press briefing in Beijing, China, on November 9, 2020.
node.description: The Chinese government has ramped up responses after the U.S. announced a diplomatic boycott of Beijing 2022 on Monday, causing a snowball effect.
node.content:
["Countries that shun Beijing 2022 will \"pay a price\" for manipulating the Olympic Games, China warned on Thursday, as a group of Western democracies joined a diplomatic boycott to protest Beijing's repressive human rights policies.", "The White House's decision to publicly announce its government-level boycott on Monday has led to a snowball of similar action by Australia, the United Kingdom and most recently Canada. The four nations are understood to have been in close contact to coordinate the collective response.", "\"The U.S., Australia, U.K. and Canada's use of the Olympics for political manipulation is unpopular and self-isolating,\" said China's Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin. \"They will inevitably pay a price for their wrongdoing,\" he added without elaborating.", "Wang continued: \"China never invited the relevant countries in the first place. The Beijing Winter Olympics will be a success regardless of whether their officials come or not.\"", "This is a developing story.", "", "
China's Foreign Ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin speaks at a press briefing in Beijing, China, on November 9, 2020.
"]
